value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">No name was <del>attached to <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-tamb" key="Tamburlaine">Tamburlaine</rs></del> anonymous.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The play was anonymous. That fact by itself</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">is enough to show how largely the <del>play was</del> still</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the <del>work of</del> <del>inspired</del> a <del>common product.</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">detached from the author, unclaimed, <del>as they made</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a common product, <del>shaped</del> written by one hand, but</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">so moulded in its transition from the written word</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to the spoken that the author had no sense of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">propriety in it. <del>Thus,</del> <del>when we</del> <del>If we</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>And yet</del> <del>Our</del> <del>The silence of the audience</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Yet the audience itself is dumb. <del>We</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">They <del>flocked</del> to the play. <del>They</del> <del>The</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Fifteen hundred people, the main part apprentices, citizens,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">heard <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-tamb" key="Tamburlaine">Tamburlane</rs>; but <del>for</del> <del>they say but one</del> <del>in silence</del> word.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">which even in our day a <del>a greatly</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">best selling novel. <del>It is</del> The flow & the speed &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>something</del> as if something were eager the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">writer to accomodate & great deeds</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>If</del> To understand that silence we have to</l>
